value: there was a time in my life when I used
to have dinner regularly with a group of
preteen boys they had gotten used to
dinner at the table being a pretty
raucous occasion with a lot of burping
and farts and elbow each other and fight
and spill things and it was chaos it was
chaos for one meal and then the next
time we ate together I put them in their
place but I didn't do it to assert my
dominance I didn't do it because I'm so
terribly offended by fart jokes I did it
because I view these things as sort of a
process of a downward spiral if you let
them away with trying to sort a
unacceptable behavior when they're kids
then as they age the kind of sort of
unacceptable behaviors just grow why not
hold people to high standards I tell
this story because this is what's
happening at this is what I observe
happening all around us in organizations
that you used to be able to count on
being extremely staid and very
professional and boring to the nth
degree and sometimes we all wish they
would loosen up and just crack a smile
and they never did and now they do and
you know what it's repulsive how can we
trust organizations whose leaders will
go on Twitter and swear and get into
shit fights how can we trust teachers
who will put effigies of Trump and you
know shoot at them and how can we trust
a prime minister who will be glib and
smug and dodge questions and be proud of
himself for it and then the opposition
all they do is think they can get one up
with a cutesy little well-written
insult posed as some kind of important
question nobody's taking anything
seriously and I think it's this process
of degrading what we expect from people
in any given circumstance it used to be
that people would lose their jobs or get
taken off committees or recuse
themselves from important projects if
there was even the appearance of a
conflict of interest
younger people might not have even heard
this before but this used to be common
and sometimes it seemed outrageous and
sometimes
good experienced people who most of the
public respected would end up being
removed from panels or committees
because of this appearance of a possible
conflict of interest but today we've
gone the other direction where it
concerns me the most currently is the
idea that we can have people who will
not outright condemn terrorist or
extremist organizations serving in our
government and I don't think that it's
just a case of one man's terrorist is
another man's freedom fighter for the
general public that could be true but
for elected officials I believe there
should be zero tolerance for anything
connected with extremism for any groups
that have committed crimes in the past
the one of course that I've been
concentrating on lately is the Sikh
extremists there are real concerns that
there are Sikh extremists within our
government some of them in cabinet and
I've been looking for evidence that they
have disavowed the movement they should
have to plainly state that they disavow
this and make it obvious that they have
no support for it whatsoever that's not
what's happening and I view that as you
know the proverbial fart jokes at the
dinner table it's not acceptable
there's a guy that's going to be running
for the leadership of the NDP party or
so he says he might jag meet Singh I'm
not saying that he has any extremist
ties but he hasn't disavowed the callous
tanning movement in fact he was denied a
visa to travel to India and he is a
big-time seek justice sort of guy I'm
asking a sincere question is this what
we want is this what we want out of our
elected officials do we want members of
parliament to be the types of people who
have scores to settle with other
countries or with other religious groups
or with anything that doesn't concern
the governance of this country I don't I
don't want that there is enough to
look after here in Canada I think that's
part of the post national thing the
globalist thing is that these leaders
all around the world are using their
positions to sell favors amongst these
tribes give them a leg up on each other
that's what it seems to me and by tribe
I mean any group that comes to them with
a grievance and it doesn't seem to
matter if it's a group within their own
borders that to me is post national the
Sikhs from India the Sikhs from the
United States seeks living in England or
wherever else they're they're sort of
one nation and their concerns are going
to have a voice in Canadian Parliament
isn't that what we set up the the UN for
that absolutely grotesque organization
isn't that what it's supposed to do but
now there's little mini UN's every
country as its own UN and unless you can
find one of these groups to align
yourself with you're going to be kind of
out of luck because that's what all of
the resources of our government seem to
go to these days and jag meet Singh is
yet another one he's a social justice
warrior he if you look into him I'm
afraid he is Trudeau on steroids
he is the Sikh Trudeau on steroids and
to me he seems a lot smarter I don't
mean to pick on the Sikhs here so this
is not about religion or creed this is
about extremists only we have other
questionable characters in our
government representing other
questionable organizations or sometimes
organizations that are outright declared
as terrorist organization and here I'm
talking about Hamas the Muslim
Brotherhood care Irfan and other Muslim
organization there's Tamil organizations
as well that we just had Trudeau in a
photo with the former vice president of
one of those I'm sure this is not an
exhaustive list I I'm sure this is not
an exhaustive list I'm not an expert in
this stuff but I can see what's
happening in front of my eyes
I can see that people who have agendas
that don't have anything to do with the
domestic affairs of Canada are using our
resources up and our prime minister is
gladly going along with it
handing out money like it grows on trees
to all all the countries of the world
all the countries of the world while
people in Canada go hungry how did we
get here
how did we get here well obviously
people who know anything about this know
this very very long and complicated
story it involves religious
fundamentalism it involves globalism it
involves a few shady players it involves
really long term plans by some really
old families and ruling elites it
involves a lot of things but how we got
here in Canada to me comes down to one
thing
and this is we let ourselves accept
small unacceptable behaviors until the
point we're at now where the
unacceptable behaviors are much bigger
we let people tell fart jokes at the
dinner table until we forgot that that's
unacceptable so in terms of politics we
didn't stop the small offenses at the
delegate selection level if we looked
into candidates backgrounds and we saw
that they they might have had some ties
to - oh I don't know maybe the Muslim
Brotherhood or or the callous Tani's or
there's all kinds of them we didn't push
it because we weren't sure what it was
and we weren't sure it was dangerous and
we looked around and maybe we saw oh
well they operate student associations
at all the universities so it can't be
that bad we just let it slide and now
we're here now we're at the point where
they won't condemn terrorist acts done
in the name of their pet group of their
identity group I mean it's not new it's
just really bad now who would the IRA
guy that just got honored by Britain
McGinnis maybe I have the name

he was he was a terrorist well I mean of

in fact over to our side yeah they more

absolutely aware of what the penalty for

he's honored as a nobleman Louie Riel
half of the FLQ members uh you know some

were put in jail but their their goals
the endgame happened go back is a Franco

people say it's like letting the camels
nose under the tent yeah we've done it
the only way back is the hard way is to

resorted to killing the Sikhs resort
it's killing and I'm here to plead for a

Patriots of this country will we'll get
to that point too we thought we had

but we didn't count on predators coming
over and taking advantage of that
democracy we didn't count on a complicit
government either I never thought we
would be in the position to be the
rebels of our country but perhaps that
will happen unless our leaders snap out
of it unless someone shows backbone and
perhaps introduces a no-confidence
motion someone dissolves this Parliament
or someone charges the leader with
contempt because right now we have
Raiders in our midst I don't want to see
us go down this road alright everybody
